environments 0.2.0-9004
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Get ancestral environments of an environment

    parent_env.Rd

    Get ancestral environments of an environment

    parent_env(envir = parent.frame(), n = 1L)

    Arguments

    envir

    An environment or an object with an environment, e.g. a function or a formula.

    n

    The generation of parent environment to get. If n = 0, then envir is returned. If n = 1, then parent.env(envir) is returned. If n = 2, then parent.env(parent.env(envir)) is returned, and so on.

    Value

    An environment.

    Examples

    parent_env()
#> <environment: 0x5567cb9e10d0>

ns <- getNamespace("stats")
parent_env(ns, n = 0)
#> <environment: namespace:stats>
parent_env(ns, n = 1)
#> <environment: 0x5567c163bb30>
#> attr(,"name")
#> [1] "imports:stats"
parent_env(ns, n = 2)
#> <environment: namespace:base>
parent_env(ns, n = 3)
#> <environment: R_GlobalEnv>
parent_env(ns, n = Inf)  ## always emptyenv()
#> <environment: R_EmptyEnv>

f <- local({
  a <- 42
  local({
    pi <- 3.14
    function() pi * a
  })
})
parent_env(f, n = 1)
#> <environment: 0x5567cbeb61d8>
parent_env(f, n = 2)
#> <environment: 0x5567cbc2f8f8>
parent_env(f, n = 3)
#> <environment: 0x5567cb9e10d0>
